page.title: 09INFORMATION OFFICER,AYSGARTH
page.content: Our Yorkshire Dales National Park Information Officer works in the Information Centre at Aysgarth answering people's questions. To get his job he had to have a thorough knowledge of Wensleydale. In a day between 50 and 1500 people can visit the Centre. More people come in school holidays. People want to know directions to places of interest, eg Bolton Castle, and local waterfalls and footpaths. He said there are sometimes troublemakers who do things like letting dogs run loose, picking flowers and digging up plants growing in the woods, breaking down fences and stiles and turning signs round. He enjoys his job because he meets interesting people and he is glad to help them to appreciate and enjoy this lovely part of England.
